Posts.Content: Aug 24, 2008 03:09AM therese48 wrote: You are right, the word anxiety doesn't seem strong enough to describe what we are actually feeling during the wait!! I had a suspicious mammo, (results received a could weeks after mammo) then wait for ultrasound and spot mag. Mine was also Birads 4, microcalcifications. I had never heard of them!! I knew I had fibrocystic breasts, but that was all. Saw a Dr I didn't care for, he wanted biopsy. He was rude and didn't seem to care one iota what I was going through. So I decided to make an appt at a breast clinic and wait 3 more weeks. I decided if someone was going to cut on me, it would not be him. Part of my anger was just because of the whole thing, but I wanted to be in better hands. Finally went for my biopsy on July 31, and they found another lump in the opposite breast. So I had to get two biopsies that day (one core biopsy on lump and one stereotactic on the calcifications since they were deep and close to my chest wall). That was a Thursday, had to wait until Tuesday for my results....and thank God they were both benign. I do have to go back in 3 months. They couldn't tell me anything at all with the ultrasound - nothing until the pathology report came back where they actually checked the tissue. So it's normal you don't get any discussion about the ultrasound except whether or not to recommend a biopsy. Take care and keep posting :-)
Posts.Title: Birad 4 microcalcifications westieluv teeyl

Posts.Content: Aug 24, 2008 02:52AM therese48 wrote: Hi jhawks, My two biopsies came out b9, and the Dr wants to see me in 3 months. It's hard not to worry for those entire 3 months, but I have to try. I have fibrocystic changes in both breasts (both biopsied - one core, one stereotactic) and he said they want to keep an eye on the changes. I'm still trying to peel myself off the ceiling from the 6 week ordeal and waiting to get into the right Dr., plus getting off the nerve meds that helped me through. I don't want to have to take them all the time, so I'm trying hard to relax during this 3 months. Another alarming thing is I read mostly about people going back in 6 months, like you. But 3?? So I started second guessing....what are they not telling me?? etc. But I have to try to keep that kind of thinking quiet and get into other things. My worry won't change the outcome, that's for sure!
Posts.Title: Misdiagnosed? jhawks67 Shirlann

Posts.Content: therese48 wrote: Hi girls You may have read my other posts saying I had to end up with two biopsies. About the microcalcs on right with density....then the cyst that shrunk that revealed a lump underneath that had hidden from the mammo and the first surgeon's (that I didn't go with) ultrasound. It just didn't show. When I was there at the clinic and they gave me the bad news....that I would have double the pleasure....the one nurse showed me it was because this lump had blood flowing to it. And it all happened so fast I didn't get to ask what it looked like....what was the Birads number....nothing. I had a nerve pill in me and my mind was going in slow motion. My family dr had told me that cancer tended to pull blood flow awhile back about my other ultrasound and it wasn't pulling the bloodflow which he said was a good sign....- so now I'm really scared. Not only do I have the microcalcs on one side with associated density, but now this too!! And I'm waiting until Tuesday for results.   One person wrote about this on my other post, but I thought if I put this in my title, any of you who have had this might share with me, either way. Is that a specific sign? How did yours turn out? I'm a wreck.....but slowing resorting to it. I came home feeling so defeated and discouraged. thanks Therese  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Please someone tell me about Blood flow thing?? therese48 therese48

Posts.Content: Aug 2, 2008 08:48PM therese48 wrote: Thank you Ann and wishiwere. I have no clue about the actual lump. I wish I had asked what it looked like or at least something!! The radiologist did say when she was biopsy-ing (however you would spell that one) that "oh yes, there is some fluid coming out". I said "what??" She said there was some fluid coming out around the lump. So I took it as it was at least partly fibrocystic still. But before the biopsy, the nurse showed me the report and it just said something about bloodflow. Thank you for the thoughts and prayers. I'm pretty scared...staying on nerve pills as needed....attending lots of church services to be uplifted....and waiting. Even though one of the techs said it would be the worst thing I could do to stay home Mon and Tues to wait for the call.....I got a call saying I had a really bad pap (the presentation of info was horrible and landed me in urgentcare)....at work. That is no fun, to be at work and run out in tears. I would rather be home and just plan to go back when I know something more definite. I guess had it not been a little over a month of this battle of the monkeys....then the shock of the double biopsy on top of it, maybe I would be a little stronger feeling and go on to work. I'm just tired.
Posts.Title: Please someone tell me about Blood flow thing?? therese48 therese48

Posts.Content: Jul 19, 2008 08:04PM therese48 wrote: Thanks so much everyone. Took a nap and calmed a little. Regarding HRT, my Dr who did the hysterectomy said at that time stats were saying 5 years was ok to use. In the meantime, he retired. So I changed to Dr closer to home and at 5 years told him what other Dr had said. He is the one that said to go ahead and use it. I'm not going to now. You know, there are plenty of women I've talked to who have never used it at all and with exception of some uncomfortable hot flashes, they do fine. At this point, just for me, it isn't worth the worry.
Posts.Title: Looking for a Life Raft.... therese48 lvtwoqlt

Posts.Content: Jul 22, 2008 11:45AM therese48 wrote: Hi Sheila Yes, that's what I did. I took that thing off and it isn't going back on (the patch). I guess I forgot to ask the key question: "if this were your wife....what would you have HER do??"  Oh well, it's off now. And I'm having some flashes off and on...but bearable. I just turn up the a/c.
Posts.Title: Looking for a Life Raft.... therese48 lvtwoqlt

Posts.Content: Jul 30, 2008 06:10AM therese48 wrote: Tomorrow is my day for the specialist. I feel like Im having a panic attack right now.....but it should calm down soon.  Anyway....just got a letter in the mail a couple days ago from the one surgeon. He didn't tell me this. He said "biopsy at hospital" ... no info. The surgeon I opted to not go with. Anyway....his letter finally went to my familiy dr who sent it to me and wrote "sounds good!". Anyway....the recommendation he had at the end of our visit (which he didn't tell me) was (after all his negative findings so far as axillary lymphadenopathy, no this no that....) "I would recommend right breast radiographic needle localized biopsy. Thanks buddy for telling me.....I might have had this overwith. I was just certain he wasn't the one to put me under and cut on me!! Again, he didn't tell me "needle localized biopsy". Geesh.
Posts.Title: Looking for a Life Raft.... therese48 lvtwoqlt

Posts.Content: Jul 20, 2008 11:07AM therese48 wrote: Thank you so much MamaLaiste. I really appreciate the info and your prayers. Many many people are praying for me....I hope God hears our prayers.
Posts.Title: Looking for a Life Raft.... therese48 lvtwoqlt

Posts.Content: therese48 wrote: Hi everyone. Here is your resident whiner. I'm so sorry, but I'm glad to have this site to come to. My appointment is in two weeks with the specialist...the 31st. I have taken my anti--anxiety meds but today they didn't do much good. I started the day by filling out the paperwork (they sent me ahead of time). I am sending them records from my hysterectomy. So of course I  had to read over them (from 7 years ago). I had a small place of carcinoma in situ if that is how you spell it.....cervical. They did a cone and it had clear margins, which could have meant that was it...done. BUT they scrapped up in me and it was not satisfactory (they didn't say cancer, but maybe inconclusive?). So I had a complete hysterectomy because of this. Thankfully there was no more cancer in me, but I was full of dysplasia. No radiation.....no treatment....they got it all and I went for paps every three months for awhile...then 6, then annual again. Finally felt I could relax over it all. So now with this "suspicious density with associated calcifications" I freaked while doing paperwork this morning. Most days lately I've been hanging onto the 80% benign thing....but this morning I guess I had to torture myself with the reports from hyster, plus these reports....plus looking at the films again myself with a flashlight behind them to see this microcalcs. Then I thought....well, if this is bc, does that mean Im doomed to have it keep cropping up other places in my body? I did take the hrt off two weeks ago. I had used it 7 years because my dr said "OH go ahead and use it!!!" He knew my family hx....mom had bc....sister uterine....but still told me it wasn't enough to bother me or whatever. I questioned him years ago about it with all the reports out. When they told me about the mammo results, I told them about the cervical and how freaked I was. The woman dr said "that is not associated". Oh, and that was to make me feel better? Nothing about ca makes one feel good. My sister had gone to a different dr after her hyster from uterine ca stage 1 (mine wasn't even a stage....it was very early and cervical). He immediately took her off hrt saying with her family hx, she had no business being on it. Duh.....I think we have the same family hx!!??  I should have listened to her and just took mine off then. My faith and hope and sensibility has gone out the window today. I guess on the downside of the roller coaster. Thanks for letting me vent. Love to you all. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Looking for a Life Raft.... therese48 lvtwoqlt

Posts.Content: Aug 2, 2008 02:41PM therese48 wrote: Hello earth I am so new to all this information, and learning as I go. So there is a difference in what I would do now vs. what I would have done a year ago. A year ago before I knew things I would have just done what they say, come back in three months and not worried about it. Now, I would do different and I'll tell you why. I just want to share something that I had NO clue could happen: I don't know if you read that I'm waiting for results of 2 biopsys in my post. Back in June (friday the 13th the be exact) I went for an overdue annual mammo. I even joked with the girl, saying I shouldn't be here, it's friday the 13th. In a couple weeks, they called me back in for an ultrasound and spot magnification of the right breast. They found microcalcifications and associated density. Nothing wrong with left breast. So I go back. I told them I was surprised if anything it wasn't the left breast because I had this huge lump you could feel around 12 o'clock near front. They just did as they were told....right breast. Waited days and those results came back ultrasound ok.....Birads 2 (all benign findings - fibrocystic lumps). I was SO relieved. My 16 year old daughter, I will never forget the look on her face...and she ran, held me and we cried together. It had been scarey and a long long wait together. Two days later the spot mag came back saying the same about the calcs and density and they recommended biopsy. Birads 4. Here is the part you might be more interested in -- (sorry I get so windy, but this is a nervous weekend for me): I go to a surgeon to a bigger town than ours. Our equipment here isn't so great. So I think that's part of it - does your place have good equipment? Ours is trying to raise money for better equipment. So I see this surgeon and he wanted to ultrasound the left huge lump I had mentioned. He said it was fine - cyst. But I didn't feel comfortable or trusting with him. He didn't explain, only that he wanted to biopsy. I had no clue how! I was so nervous and he didn't give me time to calm and ask questions. I told him I was a wreck and he shrugged his shoulders. That did it. I opted to go to James Cancer Clinic up north, and the section I went to is breasts only. So in between him and waiting to get in the clinic, that cyst practically went away. Again, I was so thankful!! I could still feel a little bit of it. So this past Thursday I went. I thought these are specialists, all they do is breasts (people travel from all over to come to this place) and it was FULL of women. So I go in hopes that maybe they would say "we'll just watch it, come back in three months" and I could go on with life. But that the very worst would be they would want to biopsy that right breast. Wrong again!! The Dr felt that left breast (like the surgeon who ultrasounded it) and said I want my own pictures of both breasts. Ultrasounds. I didn't give it a thought....ok, ok, they will find the left it ok. It came out ok on mammo here, ok up north a little ways at surgeon, but they are being cautious.  Another long story - but bottom line, that fibrocyst huge thing on left had been hiding a lump that noone saw. And so instead of what I was hoping would be the worst (biopsy right breast today) turned into biopsy both breasts. I had no clue that a fibro could hide something!! They told me not to blame that surgeon, that these hide things sometimes. And they have the best of equipment there. They asked if I wanted to do both at once or come back. I opted to do both. It was a long day, two different biopsy procedures, and I'm wiped out. But by Tuesday I will know something. Being a clinic like they are, they all told me they liked to "err on the side of caution". They kept telling me to remember - 80% of all these come back benign. I asked "even with micro calcs? even with the blood flow going to it? (which is the case with the left one) and they said yes. So that's my story for what it's worth. I certainly don't want to alarm you at all. We have enough of that with all we have to go through as women.  My fibro was hiding something that needed biopsied. But I've had them for years though, and when I lived in another town that had better equipment, the radiologist would say "yep, sisters!!" about my fibrocysts. And it would be let go. But their equipment was better than this stupid town Im in. It just shocked me that a mammo and ultrasound didn't show it. Nothing!! So that's why I share this....new to me. Of course, all this is new to me. I cut my caffeine and the cysts went down before I went to specialist. So that was good I guess. Take care hugs Therese
Posts.Title: ultrasound results earth TheQu33n

Posts.Content: Aug 3, 2008 04:55AM therese48 wrote: I'm so sorry....I really didn't mean to freak anyone out. Mine is probably the rare happening. I too have had loads of cysts over the years, and nothing to worry about. In fact, had one (years and years ago) aspirated in the drs office....couldn't hardly feel him do it!! And it was nothing. Just a big ol fluid filled cyst. I only shared that just because that's where I am now. And when the woman biopsied it, she even commented that "oh yes, some fluid" but I guess the center or something of mine was solid. And mine had a blood flow (that showed on ultrasound) going to it. So that made them want to biopsy. Bessie is an expert here.....and like I said, I'm really new at all of this.

Posts.Content: Jul 11, 2008 05:49PM therese48 wrote: LOL Cest....that sounds just like me!! I can't believe that huge lump in the left breast is almost gone now. In fact, I think it is gone! I feel a little funny thinking back the past few days on break with my friends feeling my left breast. But they know I'm a little wacky right now. this morning I was running to the window with my film....then back to the computer to look at images and dx....then back to window....then...well, you get it. I then thought....TAKE that pill and get ready for WORK!! Not functioning greatly at work, but lucky to have understanding people around me. I think tonite even if I don't feel the need for the nerve pill (like last night) I will take one before sleeping so maybe it will hold until my a.m. wake up. I had a harder time today than yesterday getting out of the a.m. fears because it had worn off (since noon yesterday). Cest, did you tell me you were Birads 4, and had a biopsy? I think that's what you said.
Posts.Title: How much is a "Spot Mag" Magnified? therese48 cestovatela

Posts.Content: therese48 wrote: I've done a little better this week - roller coaster. EAch night waking up less.....using my faith and vitamin V as needed (doesn't take much for me). The best night I had was last night. I've been eating finally and gained back almost 2 lbs of the 6 or so I lost from not being able to eat. I went to work this week...and then class last night (Law). The instructor was so interesting telling about cases that my mind relaxed and got into something else totally. Mornings are usually pretty hard for me. Last night I didn't take a nerve pill - I don't take them if I don't need them. So with only waking once and praying myself back to sleep, I was ok. But this morning Im shaking (waiting for nerve pill to take effect). So I get out the films (I have my envelope of films, reports, disc from ultrasound, etc) and take a look at the area of concern. I was trying to compare my Birads score of 4 to the pictures in the link Bessie gave us to the explanation of Birads. Mine seem to mostly be clustered tiny ones (more concern if they are micro, right?) within the nodular like density (which the ultrasound found all liquid filled cysts) but I have two questions: 1) In looking at the spot mag, how big is this in "real life". How much does this usually magnify the areas? 2) Could some of my liquid filled cysts have blocked this one to where it couldn't be seen on the ultrasound? They did a full breast ultrasound, I mean there isn't a place they didn't cover. If I asked any of these questions before I'm sorry to bother you again. I woke in a panic and thought about calling to see if they would put me on a cancellation list....but now I'm settling down a little and think I can wait it out. I have mixed feelings. First, I don't even want to have to be going through this (none of us do Im sure) but then again Im anxious to see an actual boob specialist. These people deal with nothing but this. One interesting thing.....I've cut my caffeine WAY down. I've slept more (even with night terror wake up calls) than I was before all this when I was pushing it so hard in the fast lane. The huge lump in the left breast that was sore (no concern, plus dr looked at it just to be sure the other day in his office with ultrasound) has reduced in a few days I would say to 1/4 the size. I've very tired which alarms me at times (I've heard if you have cancer you are tired) but trying to remind myself Im cutting caffeine.....I'm taking nerve pills.....and the stress of all this is tiring. Plus I noticed Im getting a little stronger from eating this week. And last night after class I felt stronger than I have in awhile.  I've also noticed my family can't win in my mind - if they are happy and joking about things I think "don't you know what Im going through!!!" and if they are down and worried acting I think "can't you do something to cheer me up!!!" Of course, I keep this all to myself because I know it's totally me and my state of mind. Ok, so I've covered loads more than the one topic. Thanks for letting me vent.    Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: How much is a "Spot Mag" Magnified? therese48 cestovatela

Posts.Content: Jul 23, 2008 02:09PM therese48 wrote: Whew....dhettish, that is a scarey post re b/c and how deadly it is, etc. Not that I want to be in denial, but I'm waiting for my dr appt with specialist next week and have been trying to tell myself how good it can be (good tx out there now days, etc) even if it is something. My mom was a survivor (passed many years later of other things), and lots of other people in this area who have had it and been clear for years. I guess I'm trying my best to focus on that so if he says it doesn't look good, I don't go totally nuts. I will be increasing my anxiety meds erin - my husband is the worst for me too. Ever since I got the news of my mammo needing further investigation (about 4 weeks ago) my husband has been sick and in bed. He's so wrapped into his own mystery illness (dr sent him for bloodwork, ekg, etc etc) that he's had little time for me. Of course, with my mood it doesn't much matter. I did tell him though that if I have to have procedures done and he is still "sick" (he is somewhat of a hypochondriac who has never faced a scarey illness or disease in reality) that we would have to hire someone to care for us.  He also downplays my issues too, but you know, if he freaked I wouldn't be happy either lol. Im just not happy about the entire thing!
Posts.Title: Very Angry! LisaG42 BessB

Posts.Content: Jul 16, 2008 09:36PM therese48 wrote: I'm sorry you are having to put up with this Lisa. The stupid comments I'm getting from people are on the flip side....."OH well, I should go for a mammo....my aunt died of bc...." etc. I had to hold my hand out the other day and tell a girl "STOP!! I do NOT need to hear that!!"  It's so hard for me to stay positive waiting to see the specialist....and to have people tell me horror stories....just feels so insensitive. If you want to "give" me something.....I could use hope right now....not doom and gloom. I want to keep the hope that this is benign....but at the same time prepare so far as looking at others who have it or have had it....and are doing great. But if they can't be sensitive to how I feel or how they would feel, they just need to keep their traps shut.

Posts.Title: How much is a "Spot Mag" Magnified? therese48 cestovatela

Posts.Content: Aug 18, 2008 06:55AM therese48 wrote: Kimberly, I just noticed you asked how long. It has been 2 1/2 weeks.....three on Thurs of this week. The weekend after I got results (weekend before this last one) I thought I should feel great and went running to a couple yard sales...lugging stuff around...only to come home totally exhausted. I think that started my anxiety because I started worrying about how exhausted I was, forgetting that anxiety for 6 weeks before the procedure, then the horrid weekend wait for results, would wear out anyone. I'm still tired! Maybe partly depression too. I rested last night and this morning that isn't feeling like it was last night. I had also been using my right arm while tensed up to play a computer game (to get my mind focused). I also later realized when I touched my breast very very lightly in that area, I could feel that sensation up toward my shoulder. That convinced me it had to be a nerve or healing thing. They did poke a pretty big place, several times. When this place takes a biopsy (core and stereotactic) they get 6-8 pieces to be sure. And that breast had lots and lots of shots since it was a little more ouchy. I don't think its the fact it was stereotactic in itself, but because it was a deep place...near my chest wall.
Posts.Title: Question Please Help! therese48 therese48

Posts.Content: Jul 5, 2008 04:33AM therese48 wrote: That's a way to put it like leaf said....it sounds like a jackhammer. Being a little claustrophobic, I was uneasy about being in a tube, so the ones I've had have been in an open MRI where the sides are open. I had one on my head years ago and that was weird. They put a helmet like thing on me and said "do not swallow" (I think that was the head one) which immediately made me want to swallow!
Posts.Title: Is an operation on the cards? charmed-imsure Shirlann

Posts.Content: Aug 18, 2008 10:02AM therese48 wrote: I'm so glad I read this post!! I had posted earlier with a question on whether or not the chip can move because of these "zinging" feelings. They put the titanium marker chips in both sides and I freaked myself out thinking it was moving with these zings!  But I didn't know that word and didn't know how to describe it! I had a stereotactic on the right (the real zinging side) and core on the left, same day. Left doesn't give me much problem at all, not too much soreness, but some. The stereotactic left me a little more sore and it's been 2 1/2 weeks for me too - we had our biopsies on the same day newmomto1. It was weird how it hit. I finally got relaxed tonite and in a hot tub, and those zinging pains started. But they don't stay local to the area I was biopsied....kind of spread up through the muscle like spar said....streaking. I was thinking ( and hoping no chip movement) possibly nerves and/or muscles. I mean afterall, they did poke in through the tissue, etc to get the biopsies! Take care newmomto1.
Posts.Title: Pain weeks after biospsy??? newmomto1 therese48

Posts.Content: Aug 1, 2008 10:14PM therese48 wrote: Thank you all. I had never heard of this and when they said they were leaving clips in me, it was a bit startling. Thank you.
Posts.Title: Waiting for 2 Biopsy Rpts :-/ therese48 therese48

Posts.Content: therese48 wrote: Hi everyone. I am going on two weeks of being told both my biopsies were benign, one from each breast. They put chips in to mark where the biopsy was taken. Can the titanium (I think that's what they are made of) chips they put in your breasts move? Today Im freaking a little (actually this evening). I was so horribly stressed during the long wait and now an old friend of mine is visiting - anxiety attacks. So my body has been pretty tensed up the past week. I have a history of doing this - having anxiety attacks after the fact (a life crisis, etc).  I think all the feelings I numbed with nerve pills are catching up so I'm tense in my body a lot. Anyway, I don't know if I'm just tensing those muscles or what. But I noticed a new pain going from the area where they did the stereotactic biopsy up to my shoulder (off and on). Actually, even when I touch the area, the "pain" (actually it isn't excruciating, just a little pain like feeling) goes from the area up to my shoulder upon touch. It feels muscular, as do the pains from tensing my back, ribs, etc feels, but this is a little strange. A new one. Could it be that the area is just taking it's time healing - maybe nerve endings? or muscle?...and this is little pains from healing, or does anyone know if these chips can move?? THAT is what is freaking me out! Thanks! Therese Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Question Please Help! therese48 therese48

Posts.Content: Aug 17, 2008 07:49PM therese48 wrote: Thanks Kimberly Yes, I've been so thankful they were benign. I will be going back in three months for them to keep an eye on things. I went to a breast cancer clinic that is part of a large cancer center. I tried calling their 24/7 line, but the guy said there isn't anyone to answer questions except Mon-Fri 8-5. I am noticing other twinging pains as I relax. Actually, that's when I noticed it, when I finally relaxed in a hot tub tonite. And as I sit here and talk myself down and relax more, I'm noticing other pains not even close to the breast....just twinges. And just noticed one in the other breast. So I am thinking more possibly from remaining so tensed up. I'm hoping anyway! I will call them in the morning. I don't do real well with relaxation techniques because by the time I need them I'm so far gone I have to ride it out pretty much. Not fun, but something I've been burdened with all my life as a post-response to stressful times. It bothered me because I finally got myself relaxed in a hot tub. What I can do for stress when I get to feeling a little better is start walking again. That is the best stress relief and prevention that I've ever done. It just so happened when this came about I hadn't walked in a long long time and had gotten out of shape with FT work and school, both requiring me to sit on my bum in front of computer lots and lots of hours. I will say the stereotactic side has left a little more soreness than the core biopsy side.
Posts.Title: Question Please Help! therese48 therese48

Posts.Content: Aug 6, 2008 06:19AM therese48 wrote: Well, that was just weird to me. I don't do well with this health stuff. Can you imagine how I reacted several years ago when they found a nodule on my thyroid...ended up solid...and they told me I needed a scan and I would have to swallow a "radioactive isotope" pill?? I was sure that pill would do me in. I'd never heard of that either!! Thankfully that was ok too....it disappeared (the nodule).   They told me my clips are kind of like half moon shaped. I think they did take more films after placing them. It was quite a day so I don't remember all the specifics - 2 nerve pills (I don't take pills much) and no food. Thank you Donna. They ended up benign fibrocystic changes. Even with the calcifications. THANK God!! With family hx and since this was my first time there, they want me back in 3 months to check for changes in them. This is a b/c clinic and they told me they prefer to "err on the side of caution".

Since we had our biopsies the same day, I'm wondering if there is something about this 2 1/2 week mark where your nerves and muscles start saying "ouch!" Honestly, it hasn''t been sore at all and now is sore to touch. I was blaming the chip for my right breast soreness last night but now with the left more sore too I can't help but think the healing is just taking a bit. And like you, I have no swelling, bruising, heat, nothing but the increased soreness Just thought I would chime in. Therese
Posts.Title: Pain weeks after biospsy??? newmomto1 therese48

Posts.Content: therese48 wrote: I wrote this on the other board, not sure if the same people were here or not. It looks like it's some of the same....so sorry for the repeat. I had seen a surgeon, didn't like or trust him. Didn't stick around for any questions....when I was obviously falling apart he shrugged his shoulders. I had a place with calcs and associated density on right breast, extreme posterior. I also had a huge cyst on the left, but the mammo didn't show anything wrong with it. This surgeon ultrasounded it (and I was mad, thinking he just wanted to make money lol) but also said cyst. I opted to go to a specialist up north at a breast clinic. That's all they do - boobs. Gobs of us sitting around in robes....very very professional, nice and encouraging workers there. THe surgeon was still "a surgeon" with a little attitude....but at least gave me time for questions....and tried to calm me down. He said he isn't into guessing by photos because he has guessed before and been wrong, both ways. Meaning he thought sure something was cancer....it wasn't on biopsy. Then he thought sure something wasn't cancer and on biopsy it was. So he won't guess. So this "cyst" that reduced in size (I had cut my caffeine because I didn't figure it helped my nerves....plus with huge fibrocystic breast, I thought it would be best. I had hoped the other suspicious place would leave too. Anyway.....the cyst reduced and revealed ANOTHER suspicious lump. Now since they just found it there, I had no report and have no clue of the Birads number. Didn't even think to ask about it. So they had set up the needle guided biopsy down a few rooms for the right breast (calcs) but wanted their own ultrasound first. AND he wanted to ultrasound the left just to be sure. I didn't think anything of the left. So here he is....outside my door and I heard him say "this turned out worse than what we thought". Oh GREAT....that isn't ME is it??? So he and his nurse walk in and say "well, we had a little turn around here". I am thinking "OH....GOOD news?? Or maybe left instead of right??" Nope....nada....wrong. BOTH breast need biopsy. He said he would "try" to work me in since they had so many biopsys. He was apologetic and said he would do his best, but he may have to impose and ask me to come back for the second biopsy. He asked if I was "up" for two biopsys. I thought "Im not UP for ANY of this" but said DO IT. I did ask if anyone else got 2 at the same time and he said oh yes, 2 and sometimes 3! Next comes in the nurse...saying "He is MAD!!! He saw how long you have been waiting and he's getting you in!!" So off I go.....appointment was at 11 am...this is about 2:30. No food (they had snack trays but who wants to eat!!) and they did the core biopsy first. Then across the hall for the sterotactic biopsy on right (couldn't do an ultrasound guided on it...too deep). The suspicious thing about the left breast lump is that the blood was flowing to it. Too bad my family Dr had told me how cancer pulls blood toward it. Too much info.....a little freaked here. But resorting to lack of control over all this. Have any of you heard of blood flowing to something that was ok?? Benign?? Crap. I hope so. This didn't show on the mammo from this vet clinic here (this hopital equipment isn't good - sorry for sarcasm)....and even didn't show on ultrasound at first surgeon. That huge cyst was hiding this lump :-( They said this sometimes happens. OH and another question.....they put discs in both breasts. I asked what those were for and they said 1) if it is something, the Dr will know exactly where to go and 2) if it isn't, then future mammos will see you have already had a biopsy in that place. I was thinking "YEAH RIGHT....you all KNOW this is BOTH cancer and aren't telling me and you are getting me ready for the surgery that you KNOW is going to happen!!!" That was my thoughts. Then I said "well, do you know anyone who has a disc that was nothing?" The radiologist sweetheart said "I have one!!!!!" Then they said "OH yes, there are Millions of women out there with these!" Does anyone here have this disc thing in you??? Or should I post another question about it to get attention from someone who does? So I guess the 2 questions are 1) have you heard of blood flow going to a lump but it was still benign and 2) have you heard of these discs?  are they routine for breast clinics? any info? Ok, thanks for listening. They told me I would know something Monday or Tuesday. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Waiting for 2 Biopsy Rpts :-/ therese48 therese48

Posts.Content: Jul 4, 2008 09:47AM therese48 wrote: Hi charmed. I asked on my thread what you were going through, then I found this.  I've had several MRI's from wrecks I was in (in the past) and noone is allowed in the room with you. At least they weren't with me. In fact, even the person doing it was in another room, but had a speaker to talk to me and hear me. They really aren't that bad, noisy (the machine makes loud noises) but after going through the first one, I realized I could make up tunes or sing songs in my head to the different beats. Each of my MRI's were about 45 minutes. Being put under - I don't like that either. But when I had my hysterectomy 7 years ago I had to just do it. Actually, I had two surgeries, pretty much back to back - about 2 or 3 weeks apart. The Dr knew how scared I was and was there for me pretty well. He encouraged me to pray, which you don't get from every dr. Of course as luck would have he retired. But there are others out there.
Posts.Title: Is an operation on the cards? charmed-imsure Shirlann

Posts.Content: Aug 6, 2008 05:58AM therese48 wrote: I had a core biopsy on left last Thursday, on the outer left area of breast. They also left a marker. A few days later I noticed a little swelling and soreness under my left arm. Its gone now.
Posts.Title: Can a Core biopsy cause lymph node to swell cjh therese48

Posts.Content: Aug 18, 2008 02:49AM therese48 wrote: My Dr called me with "fibrocystic changes" and the breast clinic wants to see me in 3 months. Now I've read and heard 6 months...but 3? I didn't see my path report, but honestly with my inability to calm myself down through the ordeal, I don't think I will ask for it for now. I know it would probably be wiser to do that, but I am going to a place where that is all they do - breast care. So in order to get a little sanity back (reprieve from continual worry), I'm going to try to let go and just think of what Bessie said for the next few months until November when I go back. Interesting thing to share here. When I was there on the 31st, I could almost see the statistics I've read about here. Packed with women, large facility, most all equipment on location. Some women coming in for chemo, etc., others waiting for mammos and many getting biopsies that day. They were "backed up on biopsies". Even though I didn't know any of these women since it's in a large city a couple hours away, I certainly didn't feel so alone!
Posts.Title: Can you help me w/ my path report? newmomto1 therese48
